text: Tried Yi Pin's Hokkien Mee and was amazed by its delicious flavours. This dish is more like a seafood Hokkien mee with addition of lala (white clams) to typical prawns and calamari. It has nice flavours and not salty. One of the better Hokkien mee that I have tried. Will go back for more.

This is a non-smoking coffeeshop, but people are always smoking at the tables and cause the whole area to reek of 2nd hand smoke. There are many kids here as there is a Sparketots above. The operator is turning a blind eye to it. Reported to NEA for follow up.

Atmosphere: normal coffeeshop ambient but the coffeeshop is new and well ventilated.

Service: good service. The servers are friendly courteous and gives good suggestions.

Food: Sambal stingray, gamheong lala and stir fried potato leaves are awesome 😎😎

Come as a big group to eat quite nice atmosphere.

Can enjoy the other food in this coffee shop
The food was slow and expensive, the waiter had a bad attitude. Will not come here again.
Food was amazing especially the chilli crab sauce was sooo good and the curry fish head too. Shiok. Worth the visit. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
